intro: Mimetes rehmanii, commonly known as the Cape goldbos, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a succulent, shrub-like appearance. It produces small, tubular flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Mimetes rehmanii is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
